contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = ''Bargainville'' | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = Moxy Früvous | Cover =moxybargainville.jpg | Released = July 20, 1993 | Recorded = 1993, [[Hurley (town), New York|Hurley, New York]] | Genre = Rock | Length = 52:07 | Label = [[Warner Music Canada]], [[WEA/Atlantic|Atlantic Records]] | Producer = [[Moxy Früvous]] | Last album = ''[[Moxy Früvous (album)|Moxy Früvous (The Indie Tape)]]''<br />(1992) | This album = '''''Bargainville'''''<br />(1993) | Next album = ''[[Wood (album)|Wood]]''<br />(1995) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r191426}}</ref> }} '''''Bargainville''''' was a 1993 (see [[1993 in music]]) [[album]] by [[Canada|Canadian]] band [[Moxy Früvous]], their first major-[[record label|label]] release. This disc's subject matter is divided between [[comedy]] and serious personal, social, and [[ecology|ecological]] issues. ''Bargainville'' was released on July 20, 1993 in Canada by [[Warner Music Canada]] and on February 8, 1994 in the US by [[Warner Music Group|WEA/Atlantic Records]]. ==Track listing== #"River Valley" – 3:24 #"Stuck in the 90's" – 4:26 #"B.J. Don't Cry" – 3:19 #"Video Bargainville" – 4:15 #"Fell in Love" – 4:24 #"The Lazy Boy" – 3:14 #"[[My Baby Loves a Bunch of Authors]]" – 2:33 #"The Drinking Song" – 5:07 #"Morphée" – 2:13 #"[[King of Spain (song)|King of Spain]]" – 2:58 #"Darlington Darling" – 3:36 #"Bittersweet" – 3:25 #"Laika" – 2:53 #"[[Spider-Man (theme song)|Spiderman]]" – 1:44 #"Gulf War Song" – 4:02 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.fruvous.com/bargain.html Official site with liner notes and lyrics] {{1990s-rock-album-stub}} [[Category:1993 albums]] [[Category:Moxy Früvous albums]]
